definition: to have in one's person (feelings, talent etc)
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: Mrs. Archer and her group felt a certain timidity concerning these persons.
sentences.chinese: 對這班人阿切爾夫人和她那個小圈子懷有某種畏怯感。

sentences.english: He didn't owe her ill will.
If you are withholding information to protect the children, you can only do that for so long.
sentences.chinese: 如果你還是懷有保護孩子的信息，你只能暫時這樣做。

sentences.english: She had a true sisterly feeling for her brother.
sentences.chinese: 她對兄長懷有真正的骨肉之情。

sentences.english: Jack distinguishes himself with the hoi polloi by his radical opinion on politics.
sentences.chinese: 傑克因懷有激進的政治觀點而不同於大衆。

sentences.english: Comrade Zhang Side had a deep love for the Party.
sentences.chinese: 張思德同志對黨懷有深厚的愛。

sentences.english: ZZ: Ya, I still have the dream.
sentences.chinese: 對，時至今日，我依然懷有這個夢想。

sentences.english: the judge has prejudice to the juicy fruit.
sentences.chinese: 法官對這類多汁生果懷有結果見。

sentences.english: Before I started traveling, I hated supermarkets.
sentences.chinese: 旅行生涯之始，我一直對超市懷有餘恨。

sentences.english: A switch-hitter in baseball should be naturally ambidextrous .
sentences.chinese: 一個開關在棒球擊球手應自然懷有二心的。

sentences.english: Untrained people with other things on their minds can make serious economic errors.
sentences.chinese: 懷有其它顧慮的非專業人士可能會犯嚴重的經濟錯誤。

sentences.english: Mrs Bruni-Sarkozy is pregnant with her second child and has been rather quiet about it.
sentences.chinese: 現正布呂尼正懷有她的第二個小孩，對此她相當淡定。

sentences.english: Their hostile looks showed that I was unwelcome.
sentences.chinese: 他們懷有敵意的表情，顯示出我不受歡迎。

sentences.english: Picture that person and hold onto that unwillingness to forgive.
sentences.chinese: 心裏想象着這個人，和那心中懷有的不情願。

sentences.english: Even then, on that snowy day, I had my doubts.
sentences.chinese: 即使那樣，在那個雪天，我對傑克仍有懷有疑慮。

sentences.english: Archer and her group felt a certain timidity concerning these persons.
sentences.chinese: 對這班人阿切爾夫人和她那個小圈子懷有某種畏怯感。
